meta.content: Corrections; Books; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

abstract.p: Corrections of June 10 article about new translations of Sigmund Freud's works

block.p: An article in Arts & Ideas on June 10 about new translations of Sigmund Freud's works overstated what is to be included in a revised version of the Standard Edition of Freud's works, to be published in 2002 by Hogarth Press in England. It will not include four volumes of Freud's neuroscientific writings, which are to be published separately by Karnac Books.

The article also misstated the name of an organization that handles requests for permission to use copyrighted Freud material and misspelled the surname of its director. It is Sigmund Freud Copyrights, not Copyright, and the director is Mark Paterson, not Patterson.

An article in Arts & Ideas on June 10 about new translations of Sigmund Freud's works overstated what is to be included in a revised version of the Standard Edition of Freud's works, to be published in 2002 by Hogarth Press in England. It will not include four volumes of Freud's neuroscientific writings, which are to be published separately by Karnac Books.

The article also misstated the name of an organization that handles requests for permission to use copyrighted Freud material and misspelled the surname of its director. It is Sigmund Freud Copyrights, not Copyright, and the director is Mark Paterson, not Patterson.
